args:
After Ryszarda and Raphael invite her to Grams,
Nino considers her future while hiding out in
Peng Lai. Tobias proposes a stroll to lighten
her mood, but the two become split, and Tobias
overhears Ryszarda and Raphael speaking...
What is this place? So many PEOPLE...
It was built by immigrants from Taiwu,\nso the Church has no foothold here.
I've passed through Peng Lai a few times\nin my travels. I have a fair number of\nlocal connections. We'll be safe awhile.
Of course. But to more pressing matters,\nare you two hungry? I know a food stall\nthat's out of this world.
We can think of what comes next over a\nnice, hot meal.
That sounds like a fine plan.
Shortly before arriving at Peng Lai,\nsoon after Nino and Tobias's rescue...
Thank you for your aid, er...?
I am Ryszarda, an apostle. This is the\nangel Raphael, whose Sigil I bear.
An apostle and her angel? What brings the\nelites of the Northern Church to see us?
We've come to ensure the safety of the\nyoung lady. She'll find no quarter in the\nSouthern Church's domain.
Our intelligence indicates the Southern\nChurch seeks to purge Nino...the scion of\nthe Goddess.
A discovery we made while sorting through\nthe personal effects of the late Paladyn\nJohannes, believed dead of illness.
I know him. He came to the hidden village.
Grand Paladyn Johannes was a member\nof the Lineage Council as well, then?
Records of a descendant of the Goddess\nand the secret organization protecting her\nwere found in a secret safe he possessed.
So that's how word of Nino got out.
But neither the conservatives nor the\nperditionists have gone public with this.
They fear that news of a direct descendant\ncould cleave the people's faith from the\nPope and the Auspex.
Neither side wants the current power\nstructure within the Church to crumble.\nAnd so they race to find Nino.
So that was what Glennie meant when he\nsaid her existence was anathema...
Don't drag me into your problems and\npaint me as the boogeyman here.
It's been a thousand years since the\nsuccession struggle, and the Church\nhasn't changed at all.
Well... I would offer that WE have.\nWe believe the Goddess's bloodline\ndeserves our respect and protection.
It's what brings us here. Our orders\nwere to invite you to the Curia.
What is the Northern Church after?\nWhat do they hope to do with me?
Your origins may be a threat to some, but\nwe see it as a means of further solidifying\nthe faith. The Church welcomes your help.
The people need you, Nino.\nWill you work with us to bring\nthem peace and happiness?
Given your experiences with the Church so\nfar, I'm sure you have your reservations.
For now, I'll just take you somewhere safe.\nRest there, and think on the matter.
(The Curia would put her out of the reach\nof the conservatives and the perditionists.\nIt may be even safer than the Halidom...)
I've never had this ＂mu shu＂ stuff before.\nI kinda like it.
The mapo tofu is amazing, too!\nWant a bite?
Nice, eh? That joy of discovery.\nIt's what keeps me on the road so much.
Too much. You're always disappearing off\nsomeplace, Raphael.
What sorts of places have you seen so far?
Oh, lots. I've seen a city built of ice that\nnever melts. An island that moves.\nAn oasis in the glimmering sands...

And everywhere I've been, I've found some
new source of wonder. There's nothing
quite like feeling your horizons expand
in real time.
—Mm? Rys, sidebar. We have\na message from Sandalphon.
Head back to the inn once you're done\neating, you two.
So, what do you think of the Northern\nChurch's offer to take you in?
There's nowhere in the South I could run\nwhere the perditionists and conservatives\nwouldn't follow. North's my only option.
I gather you wouldn't be allowed outside of\nthe Curia for your own safety. You'd still\nchoose to go?
Not much of a choice when there's only\none option, is there? Besides, it wouldn't\nbe any different from my life up till now.
Just a change of scenery from the hidden\nvillage to this Curia. Woo-hoo, lucky me.
They're testing some new pyroblossoms\nbefore the big show starts.
Oh! I've read about those. Fire flowers,\nblooming in the sky, right? Think we'll\nbe able to see them from the inn?
You staying at the place around back of the\nalley? 'Fraid that's not the best spot for it.
We could always go see the show\nonce we're done eating.
What? Raphael told us to go back.
We can be a bit late. Besides, whatever\nyou decide to do next, there's no reason\nto deny yourself this now.
You've still got some time before it starts.\nWhy not take in the sights while you're at\nit?
You heard the man. What do you say?
That pork bun was good, huh? I might have\nto stop and pick another one up on the way\nback.
The buildings here are all so striking.\nYou can really feel the history, you know?
So that's what a smile looks like on you.
Raphael's traveling tales had your eyes\nsparkling earlier.
You want to get out there and see the\nworld. Don't you?
The Lineage Council controlled the chimes.\nMy family was never allowed out of the\nvillage.
So I'm happy to be going places now,\neven if I AM running for my life.
But... As long as the Goddess's blood runs\nthrough me, I'm stuck living wherever the\nChurch puts me.
You have options beyond the Church. The\nHalidom I'm staying at welcomes people\nfrom all walks of life.
You're not JUST the Goddess's descendant.\nYou're a person. If the world's faith is too\nheavy a burden for you, don't carry it.
You sure you won't get struck down with\nfire and brimstone or whatever for saying\nall this? Still... You paint a pretty picture.
The birds have all the sky above to roam,\nbut I can only watch them.
I've lived my whole life telling myself that.
Do I really get to choose? Me, a girl who\nspent her life sending dreams out into the\nworld on borrowed wings?
As long as you don't give up that hope,\nthe current will carry you just fine.
Ah. I think the pyroblossoms are about to\nstart. Let's hurry to the show.
I feel like I'm going to get swallowed up\nin the—gah!
Just don't leave my—Nino? Rgh, damn!
Great. Now I've gone and\ngotten myself lost, too.\n...Hm?
And if Nino declines?\nAre we really to take her by force?
Those were Sandalphon's orders,\nstraight from the top. They want\nthis matter resolved quickly.
I agree with you. But apparently, her\nwishes don't factor into their plans. I\nsuspect what they're really after is...
I had no intention of eavesdropping,\nbut nor can I pretend I heard nothing.
Yes. My friend and I got separated.\nHe's a man wearing some unusual armor.
Oh, I just saw him. It was over here.\nCome on, I'll show you.
Are...you sure he's here? There's no one\naround. This place is creeping me out.
You'll have to pardon me, dear.\nI was lying before.
